tp.pr5.instructions

Class TurnInstruction

  • java.lang.Object
    • tp.pr5.instructions.Commands
      • tp.pr5.instructions.TurnInstruction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Instruction

    public class TurnInstruction
extends Commands
    Its execution rotates the robot. This Instruction works if the robot writes TURN LEFT or RIGHT or GIRAR LEFT or RIGHT
    Author:
    Abel Serrano Juste

    • Field Summary

    • Method Summary

      Turns the robot left or right

      Returns a description of the Instruction syntax.

      Instruction parse(java.lang.String cad)

      Undo turn instruction, this implies rotate in the opposite direction and restore the energy consumed in the rotation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TurnInstruction

        public TurnInstruction()
        Default constructor, only for testing purposes. Not common way to create new TurnInstruction objects. Parse is a factory method for it.

      • TurnInstruction

        private TurnInstruction(Rotation rot)
        Constructor with rotation. Not common way to create new TurnInstruction objects. 'Parse' is a factory method for it
        Parameters:
        rot - Rotation for turning.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute()
             throws InstructionExecutionException
        Turns the robot left or right
        Throws:
        InstructionExecutionException - When the rotation is unknown

      • getHelp

        public java.lang.String getHelp()
        Returns a description of the Instruction syntax. The string does not end with the line separator. It is up to the caller adding it before printing.
        Returns:
        the command syntax TURN | GIRAR < LEFT|RIGHT >

      • parse

        public Instruction parse(java.lang.String cad)
                  throws WrongInstructionFormatException
        Parses the String returning a TurnInstruction instance or throwing a WrongInstructionFormatException()
        Parameters:
        cad - text String to parse
        Returns:
        Instruction Reference pointing to an instance of a Instruction subclass, if it is corresponding to the String cad
        Throws:
        WrongInstructionFormatException - When the String is not TURN LEFT or RIGHT or GIRAR LEFT or RIGHT

      • undo

        public void undo()
        Undo turn instruction, this implies rotate in the opposite direction and restore the energy consumed in the rotation.
        Specified by:
        undo in interface Instruction
        Overrides:
        undo in class Commands

      • getSyntax

        public java.lang.String getSyntax()
        Description copied from interface: Instruction
        Returns a short statement of the Instruction syntax.
        Returns:
        The Instruction's syntax.
